intro: Elatostema pingbianense var. pingbianense, commonly known as the Pingbian elatostema, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
